description.p: You were someone who aided soldiers and the wounded in warfare. Trained as both a doctor and a soldier, you focused on trying to help your allies and innocents to ease their pain. Perhaps you were stationed on the front lines and had to deal with massive casualties. Or, you may have stayed in an outpost or medical center, providing treatment to any wounded who came in.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine which military organization you were a part of, how your medical career progressed in the military, and what kind of experiences you had during your time as a combat medic. Was it a standing army or militia? Or was it a private army or mercenary group?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Medicine, and one of: Investigation, Nature, or Survival
Tool Proficiencies: Healer’s Kit, vehicles (land)
Languages: None
Equipment: A set of common clothes, a military uniform, a healer’s kit, a bottle of sterilizing alcohol, a bottle of clean water, a waterskin, and a small pouch containing 10 gp

description.p: The life of a combat medic is a grim one. These people often see the true horrors of war, and the harm that it can cause to civilian and soldier alike. As such, many combat medics are quiet people, and their personalities and be drastically altered by their service.

setters.set: Medicine plus 1 skill, Healer’s Kit, vehicles (land)

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I try to speak softly and assuringly.
I am proud of my service and medical talents.
When I have moments to myself, I try to focus on pleasant things.
I try to not get attached to people too easily.
I constantly feel on edge.
There is not enough respect shown to medics in warfare.
I try everything I can to help people in need.
I suffer from terrible nightmares about the things I have seen.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Medicine. I will use my talents to aid my side. (Any)
Aid. I will help anyone, whether it is a civilian, ally, or enemy. (Lawful)
Survivability. War is unpredictable, and so you must be at the ready. (Chaotic)
Cruel. If you are not on my side, you must suffer. (Evil)
Honor. It is my duty to assist in any way that I can. (Good)
Grit. I have to do what I can, regardless of any ethical implications. (Neutral)

select.name: Bond
select.item: While treating the wounded, I made friends with an enemy soldier.
I lost my best friend to a battle.
I once treated the wounds of one of my commanding officers.
I aim to keep my family safe and proud.
I feel as though I am nothing but a stalling point for death.
I won’t let the horrors I see get to me.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I get scared very easily.
I secretly pray to the gods when I am nervous.
I try to avoid especially grievous wounds and injuries.
I have a hard time trying to relax.
I have an addiction.
I have difficulty in showing emotion.

description.p: You have a military rank as a combat medic. Soldiers and other members of militaries recognize your skills and value, and they defer to you if they are of a lower rank or are in need of medical assistance. You can usually gain access to friendly military encampments and fortresses where your rank and skills are recognized.
Additionally, you can usually find ways to create makeshift medical supplies, provided that the land or surroundings offer such.

sheet.description: You have a military rank as a combat medic. Additionally, you can usually find ways to create makeshift medical supplies, provided that the land or surroundings offer such.

description.p: Before you began your life as an adventurer, it was changed by a single event that caused you to be cursed. You now bear a curse that both magic and medicine alike have yet to lift, and you fear that you may never be rid of it. Because of this event, certain elements have great importance in your life. Choose a terrible event, a curse mark, and a curse breaker from the options below, or roll a 1d10 for each table.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine the nature of your curse, how you acquired it, and what kind of effects, both positive and negative, that the curse has upon you. Is it one that has been passed down through your family? Or is it one you acquired during your travels throughout the land?

tr.td: Terrible Event
You angered a local witch after double crossing her.
While out exploring, you stumbled upon a magical object. Touching it placed a curse upon you.
You and other members of your village performed a ritual that went horribly wrong. You all now bear a curse.
An otherworldly being descended upon your city. Those who survived were wracked with a terrible curse.
You had your fortune told, and ignored the omens.
While fighting an otherworldly or undead creature, you came in contact with them, and they placed a powerful enchantment upon you.
Whilst visiting in a vast library or museum, you broke your way into a restricted area, and found a forbidden tome that you proceeded to open.
You used to worship a particular god, but then angered them. They have since brought down their wrath upon you.
Your curse is hereditary, and was passed onto you without your will or say in the matter. Members of your family have been dealing with this curse for generations.
In a state of bitterness and anger, a former lover of yours went to a sorceress and had them place a harmful effect upon you.
Curse Mark
Your eyes are an unnatural color, such as purple or red, or appear like cat or reptile eyes.
Your body is covered in tattoos consisting of words and phrases in a forgotten language.
Your tongue is long and forked.
When you bleed, your blood appears black and thick.
Your hand has a small, black mark upon it that cannot be removed.
Your hair or fur is ashen colored, and cannot be dyed into a new color.
Your body is covered in burn marks that you cover in bandages and wraps.
When you speak, a second voice seems to follow yours, slightly echoing your words.
Your lips, tongue, teeth, eyes, fingers, hands, and feet appear blackened and constantly covered in black ash.
Somewhere on your body is a brand mark that appears to be some kind of magical seal.

description.p: Having a character that has a curse associated with them can lead to many fun and exciting moments, both for mechanics and for elements of plot and storytelling. However, should a player decide upon having their character have a curse, it is best to work out some degree of understanding regarding not only the nature of the curse and the ways in which it manifests itself, but also having an understanding of how to end the curse or break it.

Players, should you choose this background for a character, work with your DM to discuss how one would go about breaking your curse. Perhaps your character is fully aware of how to break it, yet the means with which to do so are incredibly difficult to obtain. Or, your character may know very little about the curse, and may only have a small clue or hint towards how to break it, or maybe no clue at all.

A curse can manifest itself in a variety of different ways. Some are cursed with a disease that allows them to transform into different beings, such as lycanthropy or vampirism. Other curses can render one unable to properly use one or more of their senses, may cause one to live an unnaturally long life, or may never allow for someone to ever feel loved again. Talk with your DM about the nature of your character’s curse, and how it will best fit within the confines of your DM’s world and campaign.

To DMs: Some curses are severe, while others are not. If a curse is severe, consider possibly giving your player a small bonus to them to compensate. For example, if a curse blinds the character, perhaps allow them to have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, Intimidation
Tool Proficiencies: None
Languages: One exotic language (Abyssal, Celestial, Deep Speech, Draconic, Infernal, Primordial, Sylvan, or Undercommon)
Equipment: A memento from a time before you were cursed, a set of traveler’s clothes, a small bag of sage, a quill, an ink pot, a blank journal, a cloak, and a small coin sack of 5 gp

description.p: Those who are cursed can be varied in terms of their appearances, backgrounds, and professions. How they choose to interact with others, as well as how they handle their curses, can shape their outlook on their lives.

select.name: Terrible Event
select.item: You angered a local witch after double crossing her.
While out exploring, you stumbled upon a magical object. Touching it placed a curse upon you.
You and other members of your village performed a ritual that went horribly wrong. You all now bear a curse.
An otherworldly being descended upon your city. Those who survived were wracked with a terrible curse.
You had your fortune told, and ignored the omens.
While fighting an otherworldly or undead creature, you came in contact with them, and they placed a powerful enchantment upon you.
Whilst visiting in a vast library or museum, you broke your way into a restricted area, and found a forbidden tome that you proceeded to open.
You used to worship a particular god, but then angered them. They have since brought down their wrath upon you.
Your curse is hereditary, and was passed onto you without your will or say in the matter. Members of your family have been dealing with this curse for generations.
In a state of bitterness and anger, a former lover of yours went to a sorceress and had them place a harmful effect upon you.

select.name: Curse Mark
select.item: Your eyes are an unnatural color, such as purple or red, or appear like cat or reptile eyes.
Your body is covered in tattoos consisting of words and phrases in a forgotten language.
Your tongue is long and forked.
When you bleed, your blood appears black and thick.
Your hand has a small, black mark upon it that cannot be removed.
Your hair or fur is ashen colored, and cannot be dyed into a new color.
Your body is covered in burn marks that you cover in bandages and wraps.
When you speak, a second voice seems to follow yours, slightly echoing your words.
Your lips, tongue, teeth, eyes, fingers, hands, and feet appear blackened and constantly covered in black ash.
Somewhere on your body is a brand mark that appears to be some kind of magical seal.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I try to focus on anything but my curse, hoping it will distract me from it.
I speak often about my optimism on finding a cure, but secretly I doubt I will ever be rid of this curse.
I try my best to hide the effects of my curse, so as to not alarm others.
I embrace my curse as just another part of my personality and being. I want to find the cure, but am not sure if I would use it on myself.
I have little memory of my life before I received this curse.
I long to find a way to remove this curse so that others will not suffer from it.
I have little care for the gods.
I often put a lot of hope behind every clue I can regarding a cure for this curse.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Freedom. I long to be free of this curse. (Any).
Redemption. It is my fault that I am cursed, thus it is my burden to remove myself of it’s grasp. (Lawful)
Revenge. I swear to defeat the one who cursed me, no matter what. (Chaotic)
Acceptance. I wish only to be accepted as a normal person, and not to let this curse define me. (Good)
Distribution. I will have all who wronged me suffer from this same curse. (Evil)
Purity. I long to not only rid myself of my curse, but the curses of others as well. (Good).

select.name: Bond
select.item: Though I journey to rid my curse, I would gladly die for my friends.
The gods cruelly manipulate people. I will stand against this.
I will free my family from the curse that has haunted us.
I can feel the curse tempting me with power every day, but I always deny it.
I yearn for companionship, as my curse often drives others away.
Having been cursed, I sympathize with those who fall upon terrible times or fortunes of which they have no control over.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I assume everyone thinks little of me.
I jump at even bad gambles for any clue to a cure.
When I am in pain, I never confide in others so as to not burden them with my troubles.
My curse has a voice that only I can hear. I struggle to not listen to it.
I care little for companionships, knowing that I won’t have them for long.
I do anything I can to take my mind off of my curse. Anything.

description.p: The nature of your curse can change not only your appearance, but how others react to you as well. Your curse may cause others to take pity upon you, offering anything that they can to aid or help you. In doing so, they may give you advice or directions to people who might be able to help you more.
However, your curse may also cause others to fear you, and shut their doors and homes to you, fearing that you may bring your curse upon their family or home.

sheet.description: The nature of your curse can change not only your appearance, but how others react to you as well.

description.p: Clockwork, machinery, and technology have all played parts of high importance in your life. You have apprenticed and trained to become a skilled engineer, learning how to work with a variety of tools and even vehicles throughout your life. You might have been an inventor whose creations helped out the place you came from, or you may have been someone who worked on constructs or weapons of war.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine where and on what you worked on regarding your engineering skills, how far your skills have progressed, and what kind of experiences you have had due to your trade. Were you and engineer who worked on machines of war? Or were you someone who helped to build newer tools and technology for a city?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: History, Investigation
Tool Proficiencies: Tinker’s Tools, vehicles (land)
Languages: None
Equipment: A pouch containing 15 gp, a set of Tinker’s Tools, a small bundle of copper wire, a dozen small gears, a set of protective eyewear, a small hammer, and a set of common clothes

description.p: During your time as an engineer, you developed the knowledge and skills to focus on a certain type of creation. Roll a d6 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your focus.

tr.td: d6
Specialty
Gunsmith
Construct Creator
Electrical Engineer
War Machinery
Gadgetry
Vehicles

description.p: The life of an engineer means working with a variety of equipment and creations. This has led you to have a different outlook on life based on your work with machines and technology.

select.name: Specialty
select.item: Gunsmith
Construct Creator
Electrical Engineer
War Machinery
Gadgetry
Vehicles

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I always read any type of manual or instructions regarding a new piece of equipment.
I never go anywhere without my trusty tools.
I am always fiddling and tinkering with something, looking for new ways to improve it.
I like making sure my work station is clean and tidy, and my equipment is clean, in great condition, and tidy.
I am constantly fascinated with new developments in technology.
I find great companionship in automations and constructs.
I tend to think logically, preferring to adhere to schedules and structure.
I don’t mind getting myself dirty, so long as I am productive.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Knowledge. Through technology and my engineering skills, I can acquire fantastic knowledge. (Any).
Logic. I tend to favor logic as opposed to my emotions. (Neutral)
Innovation. I aim to create new machinery that can benefit the lives of others. (Good)
Profit. I see my creations as a viable way to make money, regardless of what my creations can do. (Evil)
Power. I aim to show the world how strong my creations can be. (Chaotic)
Foresight. I know that civilization would benefit from well conducted research into engineering. (Lawful)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I find relationships with constructs more valuable to me than with people.
Knowledge should be shared, and I’m always willing to teach others how things work.
My tools were given to me by my instructor. I will use them to make them proud.
I find that working on a specific lifelong project distracts me from any pain or sadness I may feel.
I will prove myself by way of my creations.
It is my duty to serve civilization by making helpful creations.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: If something doesn’t make logical sense to me, I get easily flustered.
I focus on fixing anything but myself.
If something I make fails or breaks down, I feel incredibly sad or angry about it.
I often find myself chatting on and on and on about machinery and what I make.
I sometimes forget how loud my work can get.
I often scoff at primitive technology.

description.p: You have considerable knowledge regarding engineering. You know much about famous engineers and tinkerers, and what they are famous for. You also always have free room and board in any place where engineers reside, and the individuals in such a settlement might grant you use of their shops or tools.
In addition, you can generally find the materials needed to repair various tools, equipment, or even constructs, and can inspect them to understand exactly what went wrong and how to repair them.

sheet.description: You also always have free room and board in any place where engineers reside, and the individuals in such a settlement might grant you use of their shops or tools. In addition, you can generally find the materials needed to repair various tools, equipment, or even constructs, and can inspect them to understand exactly what went wrong and how to repair them.

description.p: Through a series of events, you became an exile to your homeland. Banished and forbidden to ever return, you have set off on a journey to find a new home. It could have been that you committed some terrible act, or were wrongly accused of doing so. Or perhaps it was a mass banishment decreed by a new leadership in your homeland.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine what exactly caused you to become an exile, how those events took place, and what the terms of your banishment are. Was it the case that you rightfully deserved to be exiled from your home? Or were you innocent, and wrongfully accused of acts you were told you committed?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Survival, and one other skill of your choice
Tool Proficiencies: One tool of your choice
Languages: One language from your homeland
Equipment: A walking stick, a set of travelers clothes, one week’s supply of rations, a backpack, a small knife, a tankard, and a small pouch containing 5 gp

description.p: The life of an exile is a tough one, and is often filled with strife and change. They are unmoored from the only life they have ever known, which could radically change them from the person they used to be.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: Though I am exiled, I remember my homeland fondly.
I am glad to be gone from the hellish conditions that were plaguing my home.
I yearn to one day return to my homeland to prove my innocence.
I openly admit to others what caused me to be banished. I am proud of what I did.
While I do miss my homeland, I don’t mind learning of and experiencing other lands and cultures.
I often cook dishes or read books that were prominent in my homeland.
I try to hide why I was exiled, as it brings me great shame.
I long to bring both myself and others back to my homeland to live as we once did.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Revenge. I know I was wrongly accused, and those who accused me will pay. (Chaotic)
Return. I want to do all that I can to right make things right again so that I can return home. (Good)
Renewal. I will find a new home for myself and others in a place where we can be free. (Lawful)
Redemption. I know I was wrong with my actions, yet I will prove that I am worthy of a second chance. (Good)
Retribution. I will bring all of the might and power that I can against those who exiled me. (Evil)
Retrospection. At the time, I did not know why I was exiled. However, I will try to learn from my actions. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I take those who were exiled alongside me.
I have someone I care deeply about back home.
My new friends are who I care about now in my journeys.
I found comfort in knowing that there are others in similar predicaments as me.
I had a dear friend who was exiled with me. I will learn to at least give them a way to return home.
The new rules of my homeland will stop at nothing to hunt down exiles. I will find a way to stop them.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am slow to trust anyone after my trials.
I often speak too harshly about those who exiled me.
I become sad very easily when I think or speak about my home.
Even though I know I deserved to be exiled, I still want to take it out on those who banished me.
I often belittle other cultures and countries for minor cultural habits.
I lash out with anger at anyone who belittles my homeland.

description.p: Whatever your prior standing was in your homeland, you are now an exile. You are able to find refuge with others who are exiled, as well as those who sympathize with your situation. Generally, this means that you can find a place to bed down, recover, and hide from any potential followers or trackers attempting to hunt you down. People from where you hail from are less willing to assist you if it means putting themselves in harms way.

sheet.description: You are able to find refuge with others who are exiled, as well as those who sympathize with your situation. Generally, this means that you can find a place to bed down, recover, and hide from any potential followers or trackers attempting to hunt you down. People from where you hail from are less willing to assist you if it means putting themselves in harms way.

description.p: You were trained and provisioned to be a guardian to a special place. Whether you were brought up in a family that has always been guardians, or decided to become one out of choice, you are a staunch defender and warrior. Perhaps you guard a temple or sacred site from those who wish to take it. Or, you could have been a member of a royal guard or protected a city from invaders.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine what kind of organization you were a part of, how your training was, and what kind of place you swore to protect. Was it an ancient temple dedicated to the gods? Or was it a city which you loved dearly, and would give your life to protect?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation, Perception
Tool Proficiencies: None
Languages: Two of your choice
Equipment: A set of common clothes, a set of medium armor, a simple or martial weapon of your choice, a banner, a ring of keys that go to where you are stationed, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description.p: For those who are guardians, the law and upholding of vows and honor are important, regardless of what, where, or whom you serve. Thus, guardians tend to be those with a firm understanding and respect for rules and structure, while also being people who are strong and brave.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I take great pride in guarding what I have sworn to protect.
While I once had a passion for what I guard, it has been a rather dull experience so far.
I tend to create little stories in my head to occupy my time.
I may adhere to my post with honor and dignity, but I do enjoy a good distraction every now and then.
I tend to enjoy the company of those who adhere to the law.
Protecting the innocent is the most admirable thing that one can do.
I know that the place I defend will play a role of great importance in the events to come.
I guard one who is going to change the world.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Honor. I adhere to the strict rules and requirements of being a guardian. (Lawful)
Sacrifice. I will lay down my life if need be for those that I protect. (Good)
Power. I know how to wield my position to obtain what I want. (Evil)
Determination. I will stop at nothing and will do anything to protect that which I guard. (Chaotic)
Defense. I chose this path, and it is one that I swear to uphold the tenets of. (Lawful)
Protection. I will defend the one I am told to protect. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I am the guardian of an heir to a fallen empire. I will restore them to power, but until then I must keep them hidden and safe.
My closest friends are the priests and priestesses of the temple I protect.
I am the sole surviving guardian of an ancient and forgotten magical structure.
An otherworldly entity instructed me with guarding a portal to their realm.
I uphold the laws and tenets of the city I have vowed to defend.
Through heat and rain and storm, I shall stand as a shield that protects my master.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: Those who break the law are the worst society has to offer, and I show them no pity or remorse.
I often find myself wishing for a life of guarding something more worthwhile.
I don’t often agree with how my charge acts and thinks, to their continuous consternation.
I talk a big game, but deep down I doubt myself constantly.
I am secretly scared of dying for my cause.
I feel as though I will never be seen as worthy by those I protect, and thus I do anything I can to feel as though I have value.

description.p: You have a special position due to your profession as a guardian. Other guardians, regardless of whether or not they work with you or not, recognize your nature as a guardian, and will show their respect. You can also invoke your status as a guardian to gain access to the occasional restricted area, provided that you have not shown yourself to be a threat. Additionally, you can requisition simple equipment from other guardians, so long as they are equipped to do so.

sheet.description: Other guardians, regardless of whether or not they work with you or not, recognize your nature as a guardian, and will show their respect. You can also invoke your status as a guardian to gain access to the occasional restricted area, provided that you have not shown yourself to be a threat. Additionally, you can requisition simple equipment from other guardians, so long as they are equipped to do so.

description.p: You are one who holds ideas that many have deemed as being both blasphemous and dangerous. As a heretic, your work and what you believe has grabbed the attention of the priests and temples of the gods, and thus many have begun to see you as a threat. Perhaps you believe that the gods are not gods at all, but merely powerful mortal beings. Or, it could be that your methods of worship and interpretations of holy texts are seen as too unorthodox.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine the nature of your heresy, how it differs from the established canonical faiths, and how these beliefs have been received by the populace. Is it the case that you are a devout worshipper who is alone in their style of worship? Or are you trying to lead others to see a greater truth?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Religion, and your choice of either Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion
Tool Proficiencies: None
Languages: One exotic language (Abyssal, Celestial, Deep Speech, Draconic, Infernal, Primordial, Sylvan, or Undercommon)
Equipment: A pouch containing 10 gp, book or scroll or holy text, a tome of notes and theories written by you, a torch, a quill, an ink pot, a small crate, and a set of traveler’s clothes

description.p: While some may embrace your new theories or changes to a common ideology, many will find your heresies to be dangerous to the public. Thus, heretics have a certain perspective and attitude towards others and the world that reflects these situations.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I believe in what I think with every fiber of my being.
I yearn for people to see the truth in what I say.
My beliefs are not heresy, but proof that I have been called to serve a higher purpose.
I am slow to trust many people.
The gods are false, and it is my duty to prove it.
Once I get going, it’s hard to get me to stop talking.
I see what can change in people, as I have seen what can change in scripture.
If I am to change the world, I must pick up my pen and write.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Enlightenment. I aim to show everyone the truth in what I say and believe. (Lawful)
Leadership. I will rally the people behind my rule and revelations of the truth. (Any)
Revenge. I will prove my heresies true to as to take down those who doubted me. (Evil)
Affirmation. I know the gods to be the highest powers. (Any)
Discord. I am to make my heresies cause disruption in the land. (Chaotic)
Divinity. I will use my heresies to solidify the role of the gods. (Good)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I worship a god that seeks to overthrow another.
A colleague helped me with my theories, though it was not safe for them to do so.
A mentor entrusted me with these heresies. Is I’ll honor their trust in me.
I am fully alone in my thoughts and beliefs, and yearn for someone to share them with me.
I await those who will hear my words.
Many of my friends worry for my life given my outspokenness.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I often jump to conclusions.
I sometimes doubt if what I believe is actually the truth.
My friends think I’m obsessed with my theories.
I think that if someone shows interest in what I think, that must mean they trust me completely.
My beliefs are true, regardless of what others may think.
I can sometimes cling to those who find my beliefs to be valid.

description.p: The nature of your study and worship has lead you to a conclusion that, to others, is seen as heretical. It might be a great truth about the gods or how a vast system of higher level clergy operate. It could also be that you have found a way to defy the gods, and thus you have become a threat to them. You might have uncovered a fact that has long been forgotten, or unearthed some relic of the past that could rewrite history. It might be information that would be damaging to the general public or to those who maintain high religious power.
Work with your DM to determine the details of your heresy and its impact on the campaign.

sheet.description: The nature of your study and worship has lead you to a conclusion that, to others, is seen as heretical.

description.p: You are an investigator, one who studies magic or otherworldly entities and deities. You specialize in finding out the reasons and people behind occult activities, and trying to put a stop to them. Perhaps you were inspired to choose this life because of a terrible past. Or, you may have an innate talent for rooting out the unfamiliar.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine what kind of occult investigations you often do, how your skills have developed, and what kinds of occult findings you have discovered. Was it a religious group trying to perform some forbidden ritual? Or is it some type of monster that has been killing the people it has been hiding amongst?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Investigation, and one from: Arcana, Religion, or Survival
Tool Proficiencies: None
Languages: Two exotic languages (Abyssal, Celestial, Deep Speech, Draconic, Infernal, Primordial, Sylvan, or Undercommon)
Equipment: A vial of holy water, a set of travelers clothes, three wooden stakes, a silver ring, an empty vial, a book discussing local religions and religious movements, and a whip

description.p: Many occult detectives and investigators see a lot of strange and frightening things in their lifetimes, from horrible crimes to witnessing creatures from other realms be summoned in places they should not be. As such, to grow old in this profession is seen as incredible, and those that do are often shaped by their experiences into living a hardened and sometimes lonely life.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I take my profession seriously, and hope to rid the world of terrors.
While I do enjoy company, I am wary to make lifelong friends, as I have had many end in terrible ways.
The gods don’t do enough in the world.
I can’t help but inspect every corner of every room at least once. You can never be too sure.
I have a small hobby that keeps me sane.
I don’t think I could ever have a family. Not after what I have seen.
I laugh and taunt my foes when I have the upper hand.
Not all I track down are evil. Some are just people trying to experiment with new things.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Justice. I will bring every monster and dark practitioner of magic to answer to the law. (Good)
Tenets. There are strict rules that I must adhere to while working. (Lawful)
Temptation. I can be persuaded to look the other way, if provided the right compensation. (Evil)
Methodology. I get the job done, anyway I can. (Chaotic)
Knowledge. I long to know why most people do the things they do. (Any)
Focus. I don’t involve myself in the morality of situations and motivations. I just focus on the job at hand. (Neutral)

select.name: Bond
select.item: It is because of the occult that I no longer have a family.
I don’t view all occult practices as bad. I’m just good at tracking them.
I picked up a thing or too after having fallen for a member of a secretive religious group.
I try to protect the innocent from things beyond their control.
I try to show mercy whenever I can.
I try not to focus on what happened on a job once its done. If I do, it will wear me down.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: Deep down, I have a lot of things I am afraid of. I just can’t speak of them.
I drown myself in drinks and gambling when my mind is heavy.
I don’t want to find myself slipping into becoming some of the things I have seen.
It’s hard for me to open up to others.
I am too confident in my abilities and tracking skills.
I want to have a family one day, yet I don’t know if I will live long enough to see that happen.

description.p: Though others may have to go through a variety of loops and paperwork to gain access to areas heavy with occult activity, you have an easier time with acquiring access to scenes and places rife with paranormal occurrences, or know of people who can get you into them.

You also have a wealth of knowledge related to obscure or underground religious groups and sects, and have an easier time noticing clues and traces of the occult. Additionally, you are likely to gain special treatment by those who have hired you for their services in tracking foul creatures and other occult signs.

sheet.description: Though others may have to go through a variety of loops and paperwork to gain access to areas heavy with occult activity, you have an easier time with acquiring access to scenes and places rife with paranormal occurrences, or know of people who can get you into them.

description.p: You are someone with an innate talent and prowess at a particular skill, or even several. Beginning at a young age, others watched as you outshone all of your peers with an incredible display of your talents. You may have been someone blessed at birth, or even prophesied. Or perhaps you were someone who just simply had a knack for a particular skill.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine what skills or abilities you are prodigious in, how others have reacted to your talents, and what kind of experiences this life has brought you. Was it that you were a brilliant academic or intellectual? Or was it the case that you had mastered a specific skill or techniques regarding combat?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Two skills of your choice
Tool Proficiencies: Two tool sets or instruments of your choice
Languages: Two of your choice
Equipment: A set of common clothes, a quill, an inkpot, a blank journal, one tool set of your choice, and a small pouch containing 10 gp

description.p: The life of a prodigy is one riddled with success after success, and they are often the talk of the town. Some prodigies have to learn how to deal with the attention they receive, while others acquire confidence and even cockiness with the acknowledgement of their unique abilities.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I like any time that I get to display my talents.
While I understand my talents are impressive, I think that I always have room to improve.
I try not to draw too much attention to myself. It can be unsettling.
My talents are a major part of what defines me.
I often find myself trying to focus on things I can’t do well.
I like knowing that there are things that I do surprisingly well.
I like to sit and listen to others discuss their methods and techniques.
I sometimes pretend to mess up to let others have a moment to show their skills.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Selfish. My talents are special, and I should be treated with respect and great treatment. (Evil).
Display. I take any moment to show off. (Chaotic)
Divinity. I believe that my skills are a blessing from the gods. (Any)
Instructional. I try to use my skills and knowledge to help others. (Good)
Humble. I know I have talent, but I try to make a point to not show off (Good)
Results. I don’t focus on anything except the outcome. (Neutral)

select.name: Bond
select.item: My parents always tried to show me off and push my limits.
I have someone that I tutor and teach about the subject and skill I am
I have had to deal with jealous people all my life.
I just want to be treated like a normal person.
I have quite a few people who are admirers of my skills.
I deserve all of the great treatment that people give me.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I can get very cocky. A lot.
Even though I have skill, I always compare myself to others.
I wish I could have people notice other aspects of my personality and not just my skills.
I see myself as merely an efficient tool.
I can’t seem to shake the feeling that I am just being used.
I act really confident to hide my doubt.

description.p: Your talents and skills mark you as a very special individual. Wherever you go, curious glances are sent your way, and you are often the point of affection, admiration, or even jealousy.

You can use this attention to gain access to people and places that others might not otherwise have, and for your traveling companions. Experts or masters in a field related to your talents will be particularly curious and may even ask you to show off your skills.

sheet.description: Wherever you go, curious glances are sent your way, and you are often the point of affection, admiration, or even jealousy. You can use this attention to gain access to people and places that others might not otherwise have, and for your traveling companions. Experts or masters in a field related to your talents will be particularly curious and may even ask you to show off your skills.

description.p: You are someone who has felt the spark of revolution within you. You are brave, and know that a change is needed for society to progress. It could be that there is an oligarchy or dictatorship that has your homeland under harsh rule. Or, it could be that the social and political systems of your country are failing to change with the times.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine the nature of your revolutionary position, how others are reacting to these views, and what impact your views have had so far. Is it the case that you are one of many, and there is a revolution currently underway? Or is it the case that you are one of the few who think this way, and the road ahead will be a difficult one?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: History, Persuasion
Tool Proficiencies: None
Languages: Two of your choice
Equipment: A set of common clothes, a dagger, a book of history from your homeland, a flag or banner, a small broach or pin bearing an insignia, and a small pouch containing 10 gp

description.p: Those who hold onto and act upon revolutionary ideas are going to face many obstacles in their lives. Even if many feel the same, there are those, particularly those in power, who will try to stop you. This leads many revolutionaries to hold a specific world view.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I often read books about politics and economics.
I live life in the moment, knowing that any day could be my last.
I actually have no personal quarrel with those in power, but the system has to change.
I despise any type of nobility or royalty.
I know that there are both good and bad people in every walk of life.
If you want to know anything about my homelands culture, I am the one to go to.
I am most at home when amongst the common folk.
I am joyous with my friends, and harsh to those in power.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Change. I will try everything I can to bring about a new paradigm in my homeland. (Any)
Anarchy. The current system does not work, yet none will. (Chaotic)
Defiance. The current leaders do nothing to help those in need. I aim to change that. (Good)
Spite. I aim to overthrow the rules of my land purely because I do not like them. (Evil)
Catalyst. I know the current system doesn’t work, but I don’t care or know what system will replace it. (Neutral)
Revision. I aim to set forth a new system that will help with all who live in my country. (Lawful)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I have a close friend who is a member of a royal family.
I am secretly the illegitimate child of one of the leaders.
I will live to see change happen, or die trying.
I dream of a day where we can all live in peace again, though things must happen before that can be obtained.
My family was harmed by the rules of my homeland.
I have seen many of my close friends die in service to the cause.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I secretly doubt that any real change will happen.
I am slow to trust any outside of my close circle.
I am too trusting of some of the common folk.
I am suspicious of every guard, watchman, or noble.
I have an addiction.
I am quick to action, slow to words.

description.p: Your connection to other revolutionaries gives you a feel of how the populace, or at least a part of them, are feeling. You can easily find outposts and hidden groups who are a part of or are similar to your revolution and its ideals, and you can pick out the places of underground political activity in a community.

sheet.description: Your connection to other revolutionaries gives you a feel of how the populace, or at least a part of them, are feeling. You can easily find outposts and hidden groups who are a part of or are similar to your revolution and its ideals, and you can pick out the places of underground political activity in a community.

description.p: You are a local authority on magic, medicine, nature, or spirits. You are well versed in a variety of fields, and many come to you when they have trouble or need guidance. You may be known as a medicine man or wise woman, or are known simply as a witch doctor. Many may look up to you, while others may fear you and your abilities.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine what kind of witch doctor you are, how the local common folk and nobility view you, and what kind of experiences you have had as a witch doctor. Are you someone who communicates often with spirits and animals? Or are you someone who focuses on medicine, magic, and herbology?

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Choose two from Arcana, Medicine, Nature, or Religion, Nature, or Religion.
Tool Proficiencies: Herbalism Kit, Poisoner’s Kit
Languages: One exotic language (Abyssal, Celestial, Deep Speech, Draconic, Infernal, Primordial, Sylvan, or Undercommon)

Equipment: A set of common clothes, an herbalism kit, a dozen small bones, a walking stick, a small dagger, a vial of holy water, a small book discussing otherworldly creatures, three scarves, and a black candle

setters.set: 2 skills, Herbalism Kit, Poisoner’s Kit, 1 exotic language

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I like to dress in simple clothing, or even barefoot.
If more people focused on the old ways, there would be fewer problems in the world.
I take pity on those who fear death and the dead.
People are too scared of what they don’t understand.
I like knowing that I can help out others in troubling times.
When I have to take from nature, I try to give something in return.
Those who harm nature or animals without cause are vile.
I like to study the arcane as much as I do the divine.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Nature. Nature does not wait for anyone. (Neutral)
Trickery. I often play pranks on others and delight in deception. (Chaotic)
Assistance. I try to help out those who come to see me. (Good)
Death. Death is not the end, as some make it out to be. (Any)
Greed. I only help those who do favors for me or can provide me great compensation. (Evil)
Order. I try to work in regards to the natural order and laws of the land. (Lawful)

select.name: Bond
select.item: The one who taught my was a village elder.
Animals and the dead are more friends to me than the living are.
I speak with spirits as often as I can.
I once had a small village work for me and my command.
I have many friends in local tribes and villages.
For the past few years, I have been in hiding from local witch hunter and authorities.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I don’t help people unless they have something they can give in return.
I am slow to trust people from larger cities.
I envy those who never have to deal with spirits.
I secretly think that those who cannot use magic are lesser than me.
I am secretly afraid of ghosts and undead.
I don’t like to share secrets of my trade.

description.p: You occasionally see spirits or visions during your journeys that others cannot see. These spirits and visions can be pleasant, or can be ominous and frightening. Your DM may occasionally use this as a guide, or may tie it into a story or plot. Your DM may also allow you to voluntarily evoke these visions through some mechanic of their choice.

Additionally, you have an excellent knowledge of not only the local territory, but also its terrain and natural resources. You can usually call upon the hospitality of locals, and some may even approach you to employ your services regarding the afterlife, medicine, or nature.

sheet.description: You occasionally see spirits or visions during your journeys that others cannot see. Additionally, you have an excellent knowledge of not only the local territory, but also its terrain and natural resources. You can usually call upon the hospitality of locals, and some may even approach you to employ your services regarding the afterlife, medicine, or nature.

description.p: You are a student of a major institution of magical learning, studying a variety of magics under the supervision of expert spellcasters and teachers of the arcane. You are ambitious and studious, often spending your time pouring over dusty tomes, practicing the art of spellcasting, and training both your mind and body to become a mighty student of magic.

As a part of being a student at a prestigious learning institution, you dedicate your time and energy towards learning as much as you can, and being able to show what you know by recitation, application, and other displays of your knowledge.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, and any one skill of your choice
Tool Proficiencies: None
Languages: One common language of your choice, and one exotic language of your choice
Equipment: A cloak, a bag containing 10 gp, two books dedicated to fields of magic you study, a candle, quill, inkpot, blank parchment, and a staff.

description.p: Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

For you, your GM may rule that you can acquire a small extended list of spells based on your area of focus and the type of magic that it pertains to. For example, if you are a student that practices magic related to a particular school of magic, your GM may grant you an extended spell list of additional spells that involves that particular school of magic. Should your GM grant you an extended spell list, the spells in said list are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
Below is an example of an extended spell list that your GM may use or allow for a character. The below extended spell list is for a character that practices ‘magic in warfare’ or 'battle magic'.

description.p: Should your GM grant you an extended spell list, your magic can vary in terms of its appearance. Some students might chagne the appearance of their spells to reflect the nature of what they primarily study when casting their spells. Others might prefer to cast their spells while speaking in a particular language, or in a certain style that is popular amongst their fellow academics. Still, others might try to develop a style and flavor unique to them and them alone, perhaps even setting off a new trend or style.

Students are as varied as they come, with many developing different habits, ambitions, and world views throughout their academic careers. Some students may take a more laidback approach when it comes to their studies, preferring to study and live freely, knowing that they can pick up their academic work just as easily as they can put it down. Others tend to gravitate towards almost extreme means, dedicating every waking moment of their lives in the pursuit of knowledge and understanding.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I often over explain and use long words to appear intelligent and impressive.
I spend every moment of my time reading or writing something related to my studies.
I always pleasure every opportunity to explain or discuss my studies and research.
I thrive for intellectual stimulus and challenges that make me think.
I always view every alternative before making a decision or lending input.
I always get a second opinion on a topic, just to be sure.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Analyze. I must see to it that I always stick to the logical answers to problems. (Lawful)
Might. Magic is a powerful and creative tool. I will use it to serve my own ends. (Evil).
Absolutism. It does not mater how I obtain the information I need for my studies, only that I obtain it. (Chaotic)
Benevolence. I strive to learn all that I can in order to improve the conditions of the world. (Good)
Tool. I see magic as a tool, a means to an end. I put no stock in stigmas or dogma related to magic. (Neutral)
Specialize. I prefer to only focus on those areas that interest me. Leave other subjects to other people. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I cherish the relationships I have with all of my fellow academics.
I mentor underneath a well respected senior member of the academy. I hope to one day take their position.
I have better relationships with the faculty members than I do with my peers.
I love my academy and will do anything to improve it and defend it.
I tutor a new student, and hope that my teaching makes them successful.
I have a rival student who I must surpass in every way that I can.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I have a habit of talking over people.
I often speak without fully thinking about what it is I am going to say first.
I have a tendency to not organize my research and materials.
I tend to overthink even the smallest of matters.
I cannot pass up an opportunity to demonstrate my skills and knowledge on a subject I specialize in.
I have a habit of correcting everything, from spelling errors to grammatical issues.

description.p: As a student at an institution of learning, you understand what it is like to devote your life towards theory and discovery, as well as knowing who to go to for answers related to questions of an academic nature. You and your adventuring companions can expect to have an audience with lower level students and faculty members regarding questions and theories on a particular subject, from magic to history. You (but only you) can also request to speak with an expert in that field, provided that there is an expert at your institution of learning, or can request access to otherwise prohibited or ancient studying material, such as ancient tomes or items, provided that you take care of any items you request and you observe them while under the supervision of a senior member.

You also can expect to receive food, shelter, and other assistance from your colleagues at your academy or university, provided that you ask for assistance that is not life threatening and you remain in good standing with the academy or university.

You are a witch, a member of a coven that lives out in the wilds. You are wise and knowledgeable regarding aspects of nature, plants, magic, and a multitude of obscure arcane arts. You often dwell within nature’s deep forests, elaborate caves, sun scorched deserts, or frigid taiga along with your fellow coven witches.

As a part of being a member of a coven, you work towards the greater good and the goals of the coven itself. You trade magical secrets with your fellow members, and will sometimes venture off to help with some task your coven needs. Some covens will keep generally to themselves and work towards helping nature, while others will play a more active role in relation to some community, whether that is to harm it or to aid it.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Any two skills of your choice
Tool Proficiencies: Choose one from Alchemist Supplies, Herbalism Kit, Poisoner’s Kit, or Woodcarver’s Tools
Languages: Witchtongue, and one language of your choice
Equipment: An athame, a cloak, a small pouch of local herbs, a sickle or wooden staff, a waterskin, and the fur of an animal.

description.p: Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

For you, your DM may rule that you can acquire a small extended list of spells based on your coven and the type of magic that it practices. For example, if your coven practices dark arts and forbidden magic, your DM may grant you an extended spell list of additional spells that involves enchantment or necromancy. Or, if your coven focuses on wielding the power of nature, your DM may grant you an extended spell list of additional spells that involve spells from the druid spell list. Should your DM grant you an extended spell list, the spells in said list are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
Below is an example of an extended spell list that your DM may use or allow for a character. The below extended spell list is for a character that practices ‘green magic’ or nature wielding magic.

description.p: Should your GM grant you an extended spell list, your magic can vary in terms of its appearance. Some witches call forth mangled roots and dark colored vapor when casting their spells. Others conjure ethereal shapes of animals, and others imbue their spells with warming, golden lights. The style of your magic is usually influenced by the nature of your coven.

When you are born into a covenor not, you are not considered a witch until you reach adulthood and you have completed the Sacred Rites, special rituals or tasks that must be performed to become a witch of a coven. Below is a sample of rites or rituals that your coven may use to initiate members. You can roll a d8 or choose from the options in the Sacred Rites Options table to determine your character’s specific rituals that they must or have already performed.

tr.td: d8
Sacred Rite
Sacrifice. You must perform a sacrifice of an adult animal or person, devour its heart, and bath in their blood for 1 hour under a full moon.
Retribution. You must find a witch hunter, traitor, or exile and put an end to them, and bring back their head to place at the feet of your coven’s First Witch.
Protection. You must protect an animal from being hunted, and if necessary, offer forth an adult animal in exchange.
Curse. You must accept a curse that your coven’s members all bear, such as lycanthropy or vampirism. You must live on your own for a month while you grow accustomed to it.
Combat. You must prove yourself in bloody combat, either by protecting the coven or fighting a mighty creature.
Benevolence. Over the course of a month, you must provide good services for a hamlet or village without hesitation or accepting anything in exchange.
Pilgrimage. You must make a journey through the lands to a specific site alone, praying at the site and bringing forth something from there to show as proof.
Possession. While surrounded by your coven’s members under a new moon, you must allow yourself to become possessed by a spirit for 4 hours, and must endure throughout the entirety of the time.

description.p: Given their deep connection to ancient magic, as well as the variety of covens that exist, it is no wonder that witches have peculiar traits to them. Many witches, either at birth of upon completion of a Sacred Rite, often have some minor quirk that distinguishes them from the common folk. These quirks can range from the minor to the extreme, from bodily changes to their presence itself. Below is a sample of quirks that your witch character may have. You can roll a d12 or choose from the options in the Witch Quirk Options table to determine your character’s specific quirks.

tr.td: Witch Quirk
The pupils in your eyes are slits, either vertical or horizontal.
It is hard to make out exactly why, but the area around you appears dimmer than around others.
You have fangs and long, sharp fingernails or claws.
Parts of your body, particularly your joints, have become covered in scales, fur, or feathers.
Your hair is wild and unruly, and appears to move as if always in a breeze.
The fur, scales, or skin on your hands, ears, feet, and lips appear blackened, or have a permanent dark green or red color to them.
Your limbs have lengthened an extra inch or two.
You have a captivating and undeniable beauty to you that some find hard to look away from.
You constantly smell like fallen rain, mid-morning dew, fresh herbs, incense, or the ashes of a fire.
Your voice sounds both elderly and youthful at the same time.
Small critters, such as beetles or spiders, can be seen crawling over you from time to time, appearing from within your cloak or hair.
Though you breathe, it often appears to others as if you are not.

description.p: Witches are, as a whole, a varied lot of individuals. Their personalities and mannerisms can differ drastically from one to another, even within a coven. Many witches believe in being themselves, though many witches are mindful of both themselves and their surroundings, and know when and where it is best to reveal their true personalities. Given that many people may either be seeking them out for either assistance or to hunt them down, witches are careful of who they reveal themselves around.

Possession. While surrounded by your coven’s members under a new moon, you must allow yourself to become possessed by a spirit for 4 hours, and must endure throughout the entirety of the time.

It is hard to make out exactly why, but the area around you appears dimmer than around others.
You have fangs and long, sharp fingernails or claws.

Your hair is wild and unruly, and appears to move as if always in a breeze.

Your voice sounds both elderly and youthful at the same time.
Small critters, such as beetles or spiders, can be seen crawling over you from time to time, appearing from within your cloak or hair.
Though you breathe, it often appears to others as if you are not.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I often find more meaningful friendships in animals than I do people outside of my coven.
You can insult me all you want to, but don’t you dare insult my coven.
I laugh at those who try to constantly stay clean and are afraid to get dirty.
The only rules that I truly adhere to are the unspoken laws of nature and the rules of my coven.
I begin every morning with a small ritual that keeps me calm and clears my head.
I believe that the wilds will ultimately reclaim civilization. In time.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Coven. I would do anything for my coven. (Any)
Nature. Living amongst the native flora and wildlife is the true way to live. (Neutral).
Ancestors. We must strive to emulate our ancestors and make them proud. (Any)
Pride. Only those who understand the old magics can understand true power. (Evil)
Independence. My coven and I will do whatever it takes to maintain our way of life. (Chaotic)
Openness. I am willing to show the ways of my coven to those who are willing to learn and respect them. (Good)

select.name: Bond
select.item: Many of the members of my coven wish to keep our ways secret to others. I aim to change that.
My coven has been at odds with many other covens.
I am often finding myself doubting the leadership of my coven.
The leader of my coven has been training me to eventually take over as the coven elder.
I love my coven with every fiber of my being. I will protect them till my dying breath.
I had to leave my old coven behind to join a new one. The events that lead to this are … complicated.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I have a habit of being suspicious of most people.
Having seen how some of my fellow witches are treated, I am either too open or too harsh with many people I encounter.
I can often come across as frightening even when I am not trying to be.
When I see an animal being harmed that was not defending itself, I can become quite angered.
I sometimes have a habit of speaking what I really want to say in Witchtongue.
I feel compelled to curse those who have done me or my friends wrong.

description.p: You are a practitioner of ancient, obscure magic crafts. As such, most people have mixed opinions of you and your skills, and some may seek you out for aid or guidance. If so, you can receive a small fee from them in exchange for your services (the fee is determined by the DM). Services that one may ask of you can range wildly, from questions regarding how best to tend to their fields, whether to place or remove a curse on someone else, or for homeopathic medical aid. Your DM can assist you in determining the nature of other meetings you may have with others.

You also know a set of secret codes, runes, and symbols that you can use to identify other witches, who can provide you with access to a hidden safe house, free room and board, or assistance in finding information. These witches never risk their lives for you, though they will assist you in what you ask so long as they are not in danger.

Just like druids have their own secret language, witches also share a special language that all witches learn. It is a heavily guarded language, and for an outsider to learn or know it is considered to be either a hefty and worthy gift or an incredible anomaly. It is rarely written down save for special circumstances, such as notating the history of a coven or for communication from one coven to another.

It is a language that is very beautiful, yet eerie and strange. There are many harsher vocal sounds, and words are often longer and contain multiple syllables. There are also two peculiar sounds that can be heard within the language. The first is a ‘hr’, which sounds akin to pronouncing an r with an h sound in front of it, and the second being a ‘hl’, which sounds similar to ‘hil’, with a heavy and breathy h sound. These two sounds give the language a very breathy and almost haunting quality to it. It is sometimes referred to as ‘the Old Speech’ by coven members or as ‘black tongue’ or ‘wicked tongue’ by those who wish to demean the language.
